channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for RI
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for RI

item.title: Report I-2023090153
item.description:
Report I-2023090153

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-16T18:14:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-18
  • City: Laredo
  • State: RI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: T FORCE FREIGHT
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SKID WAS DOUBLE STACKED AND NOT PROPERLY BRACED CAUSING IT TO SHIFT IN TRANSIT AND CAUSING SPILL

item.title: Report I-2023090131
item.description:
Report I-2023090131

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-11T15:10:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-05
  • City: Newark
  • State: RI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED AIRLINES HOLDINGS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. A customer stopped FA during boarding and said her vape was hot and asked him to throw it away 2. Customer mentioned the device may have been damaged while in her bag 3. FA noticed light smoke(possibly vape?) coming from the device 4. FA asked customer to wait as throwing it away may not be safe 5. Customer had a paper towel(possibly napkin) and wrapped the vape inside 6. Customer essentially put it in the FAs hands to dispose of it 7. FA immediately took it to the forward galley and submerged it in a cup of water to contain/cool 8. FA noted the device did not feel hot when carrying it to the front 9. CSR appeared moments later and FA notified CSR 10. FA asked CSR what to do with the device 11. CSR then took the cup of water, with the vape submerged inside, offthe aircraft 12. Later, the same CSR advised FA that she had given it over to her supervisor 13. FA is unsure of CSR name or CSR supervisor name 14. FA is unsure of customer ID or seat number as it occurred during boarding with many customers standing in the aisle 15. FA confirmed the device was a vape, but did not unwrap from towel or pull out of water to inspect

item.title: Report I-2023090127
item.description:
Report I-2023090127

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-11T15:10:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-24
  • City: Ketchikan
  • State: RI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: ALASKA AIRLINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: AFTER FLIGHT, PASSENGER WAS ON THE JET BRIDGE INSTALLING THEIR LITHIUM BATTERY INTO THE MOBILITY AID, THE BATTERY BEGAN SMOKING, SPARKING AND CHARRING. A FIRE EXTINGUISHER WAS USED BY AIRPORT CREWS, AND THE BATTERY WAS REMOVED FROM THE MOBILITY AID.

item.title: Report X-2023070050
item.description:
Report X-2023070050

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-13T00:32:42+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-05
  • City: WARWICK
  • State: RI
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: PACKAGE AUDIT; NO DAMAGE. UPON INSPECTION EQUIPMENT IN THE PACKAGE HAS A RADIOACTIVE MATERIAL STICKER; CONTACTED HELP DESK. SHIPPER TALKED TO EMPLOYEE AND ADVISED THE BOX SHOULD BE MARKED UN2910.
